alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Montgomery and Stanly. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 626 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albemarle, Troy, Badin Lake, Biscoe, Plyler, Badin, Star, New London, Morrow Mountain State Park, Lake Tillery, and Finger. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Town Creek between Main St and Snuggs Rd, Memory Creek at Main St, Town Creek at Bethany Rd, Mountain Creek at Mountain Creek Rd, Long Creek at Poplin Rd, Little Long Creek at Old Charlotte Rd., Long Creek at Kingsley Dr., Long Creek at W. Main St., Melchor Branch at Ridge St., Coley Branch at Corbin St.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads.
